poem:
**At a Rooftop Bar in Oxford**

A writer sips  
mineral water,  
lacing invisible puzzles  
with a twist of lime.  
From rooftop heights,  
in dreaming's depth,  
slovenly spirits  
weave secret parlors–  
worlds unruled,  
yet tethered by  
the pen's whisper.  
Between the ridges  
of a tired mind,  
the spymaster hides,  
waiting for the fall.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Slow Horses author Mick Herron: ‘I love doing things that are against the rules’ It is hard to imagine anyone less like the slovenly, has-been MI5 agent Jackson Lamb than his creator, Mick Herron. “He must come deep out of my subconscious,” the 62-year-old thriller writer jokes, sipping mineral water at a rooftop bar in his home city of Oxford, a world away from London’s Aldersgate where his bestselling Slough House series is set. In". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
